cyclone.name: BETA
cyclone.current_location: about 305 mi ESE of Corpus Christi, TX
cyclone.trajectory: expected to drift west today, then turn slowly northwest to north toward the central Texas coast before inching inland and stalling over southeast Texas
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Matagorda Bay / Port O’Connor–Freeport area, TX

weather_observation.watch_coast: Port Aransas TX to High Island TX
weather_observation.warning_coast: Port Aransas TX to Intracoastal City LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Port Mansfield TX to Cameron LA, including Galveston Bay and adjacent bays
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) likely late Sunday night through Tuesday with a 27 % chance of reaching 50 kt gusts; brief hurricane-force gusts can’t be ruled out if Beta strengthens just before landfall.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water rises of 2–4 ft above ground possible in Galveston Bay, producing minor to moderate coastal flooding during high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: Prolonged heavy rain of 3–5 inches with isolated 10 inch totals possible Monday–Wednesday, creating flash and urban flooding around the port.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous rip currents and large surf beginning this weekend; minor river flooding possible mid-week.
